channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Thunderstorm warnings across UK as nation braces for flash flooding, but sun continues elsewhere
item.description: The Met Office upgraded its thunderstorm warning to amber for much of Wales, the West Midlands and parts of the North West after severe storms caused disruption in some areas.

item.title: 250,000 anxious A-level students take to social media as they prepare to get results today
item.description: Teenagers have been sharing their nerves on social media as they faced an anxious overnight wait to find out their A-level results.

item.title: Premier League stars warned to stop posting snaps on social media while holidaying abroad
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY JACK GAUGHAN: Sportsmail understands players have been told by representatives not to post on platforms such as Twitter, Instagram and Snapchat while on holiday.

item.title: Study suggests 3.4m people in England have had Covid-19
item.description: Research carried out by Imperial College London has found around six per cent of England's population could have already been infected with Covid-19 by July 13.

item.title: Silvio Berlusconi photographed with new girlfriend to 'get even' with ex
item.description: The former Italian prime minister, 83, and Marta Fascina, 30, an MP, were snapped walking hand-in-hand on the jetty at his Sardinian villa by a telephoto lens earlier this week.

item.title: Police get new powers to stop, search and detain suspected spies
item.description: The new 'Schedule 3' powers, which are outlined in the Counter-Terrorism and Border Security Act 2019, will see officers stop, search and detain suspected spies at UK ports.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Britain's A-level roulette
item.description: 'Right - we've got a new plan for deciding our exam grades''

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's paid $14.7M for their sprawling Santa Barbara estate
item.description: The estate in Montecito is 18,000 square feet and features amenities including a gym, sauna, wine cellar, theater and more.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 14 countries may be added to quarantine list
item.description: A number of other countries that, like France, have 'air corridors' with the UK to allow for quarantine-free travel, have similar or even higher Covid-19 case rates than France.

item.title: Thailand: Protesters risk 15 years' jail for criticising King Maha
item.description: Around 4,000 protesters listened in Bangkok as organisers read out a list of demands for the royal family, including reform of the 'lese majeste' law which protects the king from criticism.

item.title: Pictured: Train driver, 45, who was among three killed in horror derailment
item.description: Brett McCullough, 45, tragically died alongside conductor Donald Dinnie and an unidentified passenger when the train slipped from the tracks near Stonehaven.

item.title: Why is A-level results day different this year and how could it impact on going to university?
item.description: Schools minister Nick Gibb said mocks need to have been 'sat under exam conditions' to form the basis of an appeal, but provided no method for schools prove this.

item.title: Exam grades are in chaos, teachers are in despair, appeals are set for meltdown
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson issued a humiliating apology to millions of pupils last night - as fears grew of chaos in the A-level appeals process.

item.title: Rishi's three Rs for post-lockdown Britain: Chancellor announces plans to 'relight the economy'
item.description: The Chancellor's new programme is intended to save Britain from economic disaster amid the 'worst ever' recession brought about during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Kamala Harris's campaign debut with Joe Biden in Delaware
item.description: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris appeared together for the first time after the Tuesday announcement that she would be his pick for vice president.

item.title: Victoria records 278 new coronavirus cases and eight deaths
item.description: Victoria has recorded 278 new coronavirus infections and eight deaths, a significant drop in the 410 recorded yesterday.

item.title: Aspiring lawyers fume after being forced to URINATE in buckets
item.description: The bar students said they were told they could fail their two-hour and 45 minute paper if they left their seats or did not maintain eye contact with their computer screen.

item.title: Inside wild Sydney wedding where guests KICKED OUT after 'refusing to follow coronavirus rules'
item.description: Revellers at The Renaissance function centre in Lidcombe, western Sydney were removed on Sunday night after allegedly refusing to abide by the venue's COVID-safe rules.

item.title: ALISON BOSHOFF: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are making Santa Barbara their new home
item.description: ALISON BOSHOFF: Welcome to Santa Barbara, the new home of Harry and Meghan and celebrity pals Oprah Winfrey, Ellen DeGeneres and Gwyneth Paltrow.

item.title: New Zealand's coronavirus outbreak was 'imported into the country on refrigerated storage'
item.description: Health experts are still trying to figure out how New Zealanders became infected with the deadly virus after 102 days without a single case of community transmission.

item.title: David Blaine will attempt to fly through the air holding balloons from New Jersey to New York
item.description: David Blaine will attempt to fly through the air holding balloons from New Jersey to New York for his first death-defying stunt in nearly a decade.

item.title: Mission: Impossible 7 filming is hit by delays after a 'motorbike caught FIRE damaging £2m set'
item.description: Actor Tom Cruise is believed to have been working with a parachute for another scene at the time of the blaze, which was attended by Oxfordshire Fire Service.

item.title: New Zealand's Deputy PM says Brexit negotiators are 'not match fit' to hammer out trade deals
item.description: Officials are in formal trade talks with Japan, Australia and the US as well as New Zealand and the EU itself, and racing to get deals rubber-stamped before the end of the transition period on December 31.

item.title: Calais Mayor says UK has 'declared maritime war' on France
item.description: Mayor Natacha Bouchart responded to Priti Patel's formal request for help from the MoD as the number of people making the life-threatening journey across the Channel continues to climb.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: That was strange timing. Just as a black MP reacts in fury at being stopped by police, Unsaid Stories echoes her experience in an electric drama.

item.title: CRAIG BROWN: It's top spot for Lord Dilyn of Barking!
item.description: CRAIG BROWN imagines a future in which today's celebrities are the lords of tomorrow. Baroness Katie Price, Lord Brooklyn Beckham, Baroness Halliwell and more debate statues.

item.title: Huge boost for rarest butterfly
item.description: The large blue butterfly, which was declared extinct more than four decades ago, has been introduced in Gloucestershire following a successful breeding campaign.

item.title: City Editor ALEX BRUMMER insists there are some uplifting signs
item.description: ALEX BRUMMER: As the pandemic retreats, our remarkably resilient free-market economy is already showing signs of a bounce back - which is just what the Bank of England and Sunak have counted on.

item.title: Oldham could be next in line for full local lockdown amid sudden spike in new coronavirus cases
item.description: Some 255 new cases were diagnosed in Oldham in the week ending August 8 compared with 137 the week before. The Manchester town could face full lockdown 'within days', the council said.

item.title: Policewoman 'manipulated' into sex acts on sergeant faces sack
item.description: Adam Reed and Jemma Dicks were said to have brought the reputation of the police service into disrepute after the junior officer performed oral sex on her superior at Cardiff Central police station.

item.title: The Crown: Jonathan Pryce, 73, to play Prince Philip
item.description: The Oscar-nominated actor, 73, is said to be lined up to join the star-studded cast of the hit Netflix show and will portray the royal through the 1990s and 2000s.

item.title: Ministers face calls to freeze rail fares amid fears people will stay working from home
item.description: Critics say any rise could encourage large numbers of workers to stay at home despite ministers' pleas for them to return to the office. Commuters will face a one per cent increase in fares in January.

item.title: EasyJet flight was one second from crashing after crew miscalculated length of the runway
item.description: The flight from Lisbon to Manchester took off with just 110m of runway to spare - a distance which the Airbus A320 would have covered in a mere 1.3 seconds.

item.title: Mystery Euromillions winner has just FOUR WEEKS left to claim huge jackpot they scooped in March
item.description: The winning EuroMillions ticket was bought in Ayrshire, Scotland for a draw back in March but hasn't been claimed in nearly five months.

item.title: Home Secretary Priti Patel orders experts to help combat Britain's spiralling drug use
item.description: Priti Patel has written to the Government's official drug experts posing two questions: why do some young people start using cocaine and why do some of those continue it into adulthood?

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: Why do we tell migrants not to come to Britain, then make it easy for them to stay?
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER comments on Britain's migrant crisis as he discusses how one in 15 migrants were deported in 2019 and asks why does the UK make it so easy for immigrants to stay?

item.title: Teenage boy fights for his life after being shot on the street in Greater Manchester
item.description: A young man was rushed to hospital with 'life-threatening injuries' after the incident in Bury at 9.35pm last night, Greater Manchester Police said.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: BBC bans Rudyard Kipling's Mandalay from VJ Day commemoration
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: The poem was first set to music in 1907 and was to have been sung for the evening segment of VJ Day 75, hosted on Saturday by Joanna Lumley on BBC1.

item.title: Failed asylum seeker used two FAKE identities to live in UK illegally for 20 years, court hears
item.description: Ali Hussain Karim, 47 (pictured), a failed asylum seeker, should have been sent back to Iraq after he fled Saddam Hussein's regime and arrived in Britain in 1999. Instead, he set up false identities.

item.title: Coronavirus tracing app will be launched yet again
item.description: Pilot schemes for the mobile tracing app will begin within days on the Isle of Wight and members of the public will be urged to scan in at pubs, cafes and restaurants.

item.title: Mail Force charity hands 20,000 face masks to one of UK's top hospitals
item.description: Delighted nurses at one of Britain's top hospitals stepped out into the sunshine this week to unload the latest van full of life-saving Mail Force PPE.

item.title: Only ONE healthy child has been killed by Covid-19 in Britain, reveals study
item.description: Researchers swabbed more than half a million people and found youngsters under the age of 16 accounted for only one in 100 cases of the virus in England.

item.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins star Ollie Ollerton says he is 'disappointed' following shock axe
item.description: SAS Who Dares Wins star Ollie Ollerton has revealed his 'shock and disappointment' at being axed from the survival reality show after five years.

item.title: Middlemarch by Mary Ann Evans: George Eliot's masterpiece will bear the name of its real author
item.description: The Reclaim Her Name campaign will see ebooks re-released with the female authors' real names. George Eliot's masterpiece will bear the name of its author Mary Ann Evans (pictured).

item.title: 'Kind and caring' girl, 11, dies two days after hit-and-run driver smashed into her
item.description: Ruby Cropper was walking with a friend on New Road in Bury at about 4.30pm on Monday when she was in a collision with a blue Suzuki Alto.

item.title: Heartbroken widow, 37, gives birth to IVF twins conceived using her husband's frozen sperm
item.description: Lucy Kelsall, 37, from Bristol married husband David, 45, in 2012 and made a promise to him before he died that he would be a father.

item.title: SUSANNA REID gives ministers an 'F' for failure on results day
item.description: British columnist Susanna Reid, vents her fury that students in the UK will receive grades that are calculated by class, national outcomes and the school's previous performance.

item.title: How cost of a puppy has nearly doubled during lockdown
item.description: The Dogs Trust found that the cost of popular breeds are up 50 to 90 per cent since March, with some buyers paying as much as £9,000 for an English Bulldog,

item.title: Stephen Lawrence's father Neville reveals how he later found solace with a secret girlfriend
item.description: Were it not for the pandemic, Neville Lawrence wouldn't have been in London when he received a phone call he had long been dreading, inviting him to a meeting at Scotland Yard.

item.title: Trump's UK ambassador's comments on race and sex confirmed
item.description: US ambassador to the UK Woody Johnson is accused of sometimes making 'inappropriate or insensitive comments,' according to a new Inspector General's report.

item.title: Breast cancer screening for women in their 40s would save 300 lives a year, new research suggests
item.description: In a new study, published in the Lancet Oncology, researchers followed 160,000 women and found that deaths from breast cancer were 25 per cent lower among the group screened in their 40s

item.title: Facebook failing to crack down on fake reviews despite vowing to stop online shoppers being misled
item.description: According to an investigation by consumer group Which?, Facebook is still not tackling the 'blatant' practice that can lead to shoppers unwittingly buying shoddy products.

item.title: Air pollution cuts down life expectancy by two years, despite global efforts to improve air quality
item.description: Air pollution has made the global life expectancy almost two years lower than it would be if air quality met World Health Organization standards, according to a new report.

item.title: Facebook restricts news outlets connected to political entities
item.description: Facebook is banning US news outlets with political ties from its News tab and claiming news exemption when advertising, which allows sources to bypass the authorization and disclaimer process.

item.title: Premier League clubs in stand-off with the Government over fans returning to stadiums
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY MATT HUGHES:There are fears if the recommendations are adopted then the planned return of fans will prove unworkable and may be uneconomic for lower teams.

item.title: Judge rejects Ghislaine Maxwell's latest request to delay unsealing of explosive court docs
item.description: New York judge Loretta Preska rejected Ghislaine Maxwell's latest attempt to delay the unsealing of potentially explosive documents on Wednesday.

item.title: Boy, 17, found guilty of murder of strangled teaching assistant
item.description: Lindsay Birbeck, 47, from Accrington, Lancashire, was found buried in a shallow grave at the back of Accrington Cemetery in August last year.

item.title: Abused dog who only understands German dumped at rescue centre
item.description: Carers at the RSPCA in Leeds said that initially, Hector didn't understand English, but they had more luck when they tried speaking German to him. He is already 'picking up English' they said.

item.title: Manchester, the cat with extremely short legs, is Instagram star
item.description: Manchester (pictured) who lives with his owner in Russia is nearly two years old, and is a mixture of two breeds - a Scottish straight and a Munchkin, which are renowned for their extremely short legs.

item.title: Prince Andrew enjoys a horse ride at Windsor Castle as he still faces calls to speak to FBI
item.description: Prince Andrew was clearly feeling the heat this morning as he left two buttons undone on his dark navy blue shirt, while galloping through the Windsor grounds.

item.title: Should we be lending Kate's pal £170,000 to expand her posh sex empire?
item.description: Emma Sayle, 40, who is a school friend of the Duchess of Cambridge, is the founder of London-based sex club Killing Kittens. The company is set to receive a £170,000 loan from the Government.

item.title: How I became someone like you, Adele!
item.description: Elliot Joseph, 26, makes a living transforming himself into celebrities using everyday cosmetics and his incredible skills with a make-up brush.

item.title: The Femail Face-off: Should we kill off erotic TV scenes?
item.description: Femail debates for and against the removal of TV sex scenes due to the challenges faced when filming scenes of physical intimacy during covid-19. Argued by Rowan Pelling and Lisa Hilton.

item.title: Three of R. Kelly's friends are charged with intimidating and harassing his sexual abuse victims
item.description: According to prosecutors, his friends, Michael Williams, Richard Arline Jr and Donnell Russell, recently tried to intimidate some of the women who say Kelly abused them.
item.media:description: FILE - In this June 26, 2019 file photo, R&B singer R. Kelly, center, arrives at the Leighton Criminal Court building for an arraignment on sex-related felonies in Chicago. Federal prosecutors announced charges Wednesday, Aug. 12, 2020, against three men accused of threatening and intimidating women who have accused Kelly of abuse, including one man suspected of setting fire to a vehicle in Florida. (AP Photo/Amr Alfiky, File)

item.title: EXC: Ed Sheeran's wife Cherry Seaborn is seen with a hint of a bump in early stages of pregnancy
item.description: On March 7, Cherry was seen at Cambridge Hockey Club wrapped up against the cold in a fleece, yet her open jacket and fitted top meant she flashed a hint of what was clearly her stomach

item.title: What to wear this weekend: FEMAIL picks out fashionable
item.description: FEMAIL's fashion editor Camilla Ridley-Day says pleats are in and advises shoppers to try out the latest saffron yellow trend. Although perfecting your pleats may require an iron Camilla says it is worth it.

item.title: Finally, a way to cover up wobbly bits in style thanks to the elegant new swim dress
item.description: Jess Wood shares the fashionable alternative to bikinis...bathing dresses. That's right they are no longer just for your Great-Aunt Gladys, designed just to cover up lumps and bumps.

item.title: CALVIN ROBINSON on Triple lock exam results announcement
item.description: Calvin Robinson slams the last-minute changes to the A-Level results arrangements put in place to help students during lockdown as a fiasco and predicts it will cause a bureaucratic nightmare

item.title: Ballet school is rocked by sex abuse probe as SIXTY 'victims' come forward
item.description: Ballet West in Taynuilt, Argyll is at the centre of the probe after 60 women - former students, staff and parents - came forward. The school is drafting in a senior legal figure to examine the allegations.

item.title: Open your eyes to a virtual workout: Tai Chi on the beach and even a heart-stopping climb
item.description: Rosie Green was told by fitness trainer Jodie Brinson, that virtual reality workouts could be beneficial if you can't get to a class. She tested a selection of VR exercises available in the UK.

item.title: Syrian President stops speech and sits as blood pressure drops
item.description: Syrian President Bashar Assad said, 'I need to sit for a minute if you don't mind,' before exiting the room while giving a speech to the country's parliament about US sanctions.

item.title: Harlots: Prostitute hunted in woods in scary BBC drama scene
item.description: Tonight's episode of raunchy BBC2 drama Harlots, which details the booming sex industry of 18th century London , left viewers on the edge of their seat after a tense chase scene in the woods.

item.title: Pilots have miracle escape from vintage aircraft that hit tree at 130mph
item.description: Dave Unwin has been left 2cm shorter after he and co-pilot Eskil Amdal crash-landed in a field at 130mph near Duxford, Cambridgeshire. The pair were flying a 1951 model when it's engine cut out

item.title: CAROL DRINKWATER's enchanting account of her summer on the Riviera is a glorious paean to pottering
item.description: Carol Drinkwater who lives in an Olive Farm on the French Riviera, has been in lockdown with her husband Michel since mid-March. She revealed how they spent their time embracing nature.

item.title: Meet the chef with a burning ambition to teach women the lost art of 'fire cooking'
item.description: India Sturgis attended a session about broadening the food you cook using fire, with founder of Bristol Fire School Genevieve Taylor. She shares Genevieve's advice and cookbook recipes.

item.title: Woman, 75, plows out-of-control SUV into hospital, killing one
item.description: The incident, which happened at 7:45 am on June 30 at Atlanta's Piedmont Hospital, left a 55-year-old Kimberly Hall dead at the scene and four others injured. Driver Mary Clayton wasn't charged.

item.title: Instagram accused of illegally harvesting biometric data
item.description: The lawsuit, filed on Monday in state court in Redwood City, California, accuses the company of collecting, storing and profiting from the biometric data of more than 100 million Instagram users.

item.title: School chiefs express alarm at plan to allow pupils to use their mock A-level results as final marks
item.description: Teachers in England have warned that using mock exam results to award A-level grades would not be fair, after the government announced students could use their mock results as their final grade.

item.title: 'I never wanted that 60s haircut': Twiggy
item.description: Twiggy, 70, spoke candidly about her career in a discussion on Jessie Ware's Table Manners podcast. British style icon, revealed that she didn't want her much-imitated crop hairstyle.

item.title: Uber and Lyft say they will have to shut down in California if court upholds employee ruling
item.description: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi warned on Wednesday that his company may have to shut down service if a California court's ruling is upheld. It's rival Lyft soon followed up with the same warning.

item.title: A mother haunted by flashbacks reveals ... Miscarriage really can give women like me PTSD
item.description: Emily Clearly, 41, reveals how she suffered PTSD following her her darkest days after miscarriage and looks at the science which found the same condition in 18 per cent of women who had miscarried.

item.title: 'I became a honeytrap to avenge my aunt's murder': Luring a suspected killer out of hiding
item.description: For six years Lehanne Sergison chased the tail of the man she suspected to be her aunt Christine Robinson's killer. Thanks to her efforts the prime suspect Andrew Ndlovu was apprehended.

item.title: We try before you buy: CLAIRE COLEMAN tests hair waters
item.description: Claire Coleman gives her verdict on a selection of the best hair waters. The British beauty expert was most impressed with KeraCare Moisturising Coco Water.

item.title: Who'll find love on our blind date? This week it's James, 37, and Aditya, 39
item.description: Every week, FEMAIL sends two singletons on a socially distanced blind date and asks them to report back. James, 37, and Aditya, 39, visited a bar in London.

item.title: Everyday Ageism: FEMAIL columnist CHRISTA D'SOUZA
item.description: Christa D'Souza says before the pandemic she had been seriously considering going back to university. The British columnist has seen memes by Gen Z-ers mocking mature students.

item.title: UK Test and Trace system 'is not fit for purpose let alone world class' says senior NHS official
item.description: Chris Hopson, chief executive of the body which represents NHS Trusts, said there is an 'awful lot' to do to get the service in place for winter.
item.media:description: An NHS Test and Trace form (Yui Mok/PA)

item.title: 'Sexist' Sainsburys staff member comments on woman's shorts
item.description: Lauren O'Connor, 33, a PR director from Surrey, says she was in the Staines branch of the grocery store when a member of staff said a customer had complained about the length of her top.

item.title: Conservative MP tells Gary Lineker to offer mansion to migrants
item.description: Ashfield MP Lee Anderson, 53, slammed the Match of the Day host for 'virtue signalling' while discussing the record number of migrants who have arrived in the UK,

item.title: UK's official coronavirus death toll DROPS by 5,000
item.description: The Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) today reduced the UK coronavirus death toll from 46,706 to 41,329 following a review of how figures are calculated.

item.title: Coronavirus: Contagious particles float 16 FEET from patients
item.description: A new study from the University of Florida has found that infectious coronavirus particles were found in air samples taken between seven feet and 16 feet away from hospital patients.

item.title: Farmer paid £9k by officer after Tesco blackmail attempt
item.description: Nigel Wright, from Lincolnshire, is on trial at the Old Bailey accused of blackmailing Tesco in exchange for revealing in which of its stores he had planted jars of baby food laced with metal.

item.title: Fisher-Price releases work-from-home toy play set for kids
item.description: Fisher-Price has just launched the 'My Home Office' play set for $24.99. The very on-the-nose set includes a laptop with four 'apps,' a smartphone, a headset, and a takeout coffee cup.

item.title: Cameras installed to catch people filming traffic accidents
item.description: The force confirmed they intend to prosecute those who record accidents after attending three crashes on the M1 and spotting 'disrespectful' drivers filming the scene.

item.title: 999 calls rocket by 26% in Devon and Cornwall
item.description: Assistant Chief Constable Jim Colwell said last weekend saw record 999 calls and public order incidents in holiday hotspots in Devon and Cornwall.

item.title: Man is seriously injured after being shot by armed police in Cheshire
item.description: Video posted on social media appeared to show armed officers outside flats shouting at a man, who was on a grassed area, and urging him not to reach for a gun.

item.title: Painting a pair of eyes on a cow's backside deters predators
item.description: Scientists at the University of New South Wales in Australia, who carried out their study in Botswana, have found that painting a pair of eyes on the backside of a cow could help deter lion attacks.
item.media:credit: University of New South Wales/Ben Yexley

item.title: Princess Diana had 'conversations with Jemima Goldsmith' about moving to Pakistan
item.description: Princess Diana was so enamoured with heart surgeon Hasnat Khan that she considered moving to Pakistan to be with him, claims new Channel 5 documentary Diana: Her Last Summer.

item.title: New experimental coronavirus vaccine boosted antibody levels in mice 90-fold
item.description: After researchers sprayed the novel coronavirus into the noses of the mice, those who were immunized didn't develop pneumonia or have high level of particles in their lungs,

item.title: Sumner Redstone, ex CBS and Viacom chairman, dies at 97
item.description: Redstone, who often boasted that would live forever, died Tuesday, according to a statement from National Amusements released Wednesday morning.

item.title: Meghan Markle pulled out of Pippa Middleton's wedding at last minute
item.description: Meghan Markle pulled out of attending Pippa Middleton and James Matthews' Berkshire wedding because she didn't want to 'create a media circus' according to Finding Freedom.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Lebanese ministers face judicial investigation
item.description: An official said interrogations will begin with former public works minister Ghazi al-Aridi before the file is passed to parliament if negligence is uncovered as jurisdiction lies with a special council

item.title: 'Oldest known cremation in the Middle East' was 9,000 years ago
item.description: Scientists from the French National Centre for Scientific Research believe the remained found in present day Israel marked a cultural shift in funeral practices.

item.title: Japan's PM makes near-identical Hiroshima and Nagasaki speeches
item.description: The Prime Minister has come under fire from atomic bomb survivors for using near identical speeches in Hiroshima and Nagasaki to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the events

item.title: Finding Freedom author denies interviewing Harry and Meghan
item.description: Omid Scobie, who co-wrote Finding Freedom with Carolyn Durand, took to Twitter to clarify he had only exchanged a 'few words at engagements' rather than conduct a 'full interview'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Staycationers have trips cancelled last minute
item.description: Furious customers have taken to social media following a string of cancellations, which bosses have apologised for after experiencing 'unprecedented levels of demand'.

item.title: Boot retailer Dr Martens will pay BACK furlough funds
item.description: Kenny Wilson, chief executive of the retailer, said it was 'morally right' to return the funds it claimed after furloughing staff at its UK stores and manufacturing site.

item.title: Researchers develop strategy for identifying Twitter trolls in 50 tweets
item.description: The two algorithms account for distinctive use of repeated words and word pairs require to distinguish deceptive messages from those posted by public figures.

item.title: Two female frogs 'remain loyal to one male' during breeding season
item.description: Thoropa taophora frogs, native to the Brazilian Atlantic rainforest, are the first amphibian to reveal signs of 'single-male polygyny with fidelity' (SMPF).

item.title: Reservist, 55, avoids jail after defrauding Royal Navy of £71k
item.description: Lieutenant Mark Vickers, 55, from London, swindled the £71,000 by claiming he was missing out on his income as a solicitor while he was deployed in the Royal Navy Reserve to Bahrain.

item.title: Prince Joachim of Denmark seen after emergency brain surgery
item.description: Joachim, 51, is seen recuperating at his holiday home, the Chateau de Cayx in Cahors, France, as he recovers from a procedure after he developed a blood clot on his brain.

item.title: Tessy of Luxembourg returns to London as lockdown lifted
item.description: The ex-wife of Prince Louis of Luxembourg has travellled to London following the lift of lockdown, sharing glimpses of her glamorous return.

item.title: Stephen Lawrence murder suspect Luke Knight seen in London
item.description: Smirking as he strolls through the street in his flatcap and shorts, bearded Luke Knight looks a world away from the snarling thug who once stood alongside Stephen Lawrence's killers

item.title: Deputy police commissioner backs officers who stopped...
item.description: Metropolitan Police deputy commissioner Sir Steve House has spoken out against officers facing 'trial by social media' after a car carrying Dawn Butler was stopped.
item.media:description: Dawn Butler accused officers of racial profiling in stopping the car in which she was travelling on Sunday (Jane Barlow/PA)

item.title: Albanian gangster kicked out for attempted murder back in UK
item.description: Riza Vatoci, 49, who was jailed in Albania for trying to kill a rival is still living in the UK and working at his car wash in Bognor Regis, West Sussex, despite the government vowing to deport him in January.

item.title: Elephants chase off hippos to claim the prime spot at South African watering hole
item.description: The spectacular clash of nature's giants was caught on camera on Sunday August 9 in the Pilanesberg Nature Reserve, South Africa.

item.title: Freeze them out: Call for boycott of 'woke' US ice-cream company Ben & Jerry's
item.description: Ben & Jerry's UK branch noisily slammed the Home Secretary's call for the Navy to halt the stream of migrants crossing the Channel from France into the UK.

item.title: Argos customer 'is sent text from delivery driver asking her if she is single'
item.description: Katie Norfolk, from Hessle, East Yorkshire, got texts from a contact claiming to be the driver who 'came and delivered to her house' on Monday. The sender asks: 'I was just wondering if you were single?'

item.title: Tate art galleries axe 300 staff from shops and cafes while Natwest cuts 500 roles
item.description: Hundreds of jobs are set to go at Tate galleries in London, Liverpool and St Ives after it shut its doors for more than four months during lockdown. NatWest is set to reduce its headcount by around 550.

item.title: Why are Harry and Meghan blowing £8m when they owe taxpayer £2.4m?
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan had help from Prince Charles to buy their £8million family home in Santa Barbara, after ditching Tyler Perry's 12-bedroom Beverly Hills mansion for more privacy

item.title: Tom Clancy's Chesapeake Bay estate sells for $4.9million
item.description: The hideaway estate of Jack Ryan creator Tom Clancy has been sold for $4.9million - $1.3million below the asking price amid a dispute between his ex-wife and widow over royalties to his character.

item.title: Astronomers find Milky Way-like galaxy 12bn light years away
item.description: Astronomers from the Max Planck Institute used the Atacama Large Millimeter / submillimeter Array (ALMA) in Chile to find the galaxy 12 billion light years away.

item.title: Boy crashing bike into bins synched to Phil Collins drum break
item.description: Video shot by Kim Chvotkin shows her son, Cooper, 10, riding on Morgan Lane in Redondo Beach, California, before he crashes - in footage synched to the song's drums by his father, Jamie.

item.title: Army major is cleared of raping female Captain following a Burns night supper
item.description: Major Gregor Beaton, 33, was cleared by Bulford Military Court in Wiltshire today after claiming he was the victim after he was arrested on suspicion of rape and quizzed by Royal Military Police.

item.title: Janet Street Porter slams Prince Harry and Meghan Markle book
item.description: Speaking on today's Loose Women, Janet Street Porter said she didn't think Finding Freedom would do anything to elevate Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's status.

item.title: Fears grow for girl, 15, who went missing from her home in Kent
item.description: Teenager Maisie Wheeler is believed to be in the Bognor Regis area having been reported missing from her home in Meopham in Kent over the weekend.

item.title: Solicitor left bouncer dripping with blood after using her stiletto 'as a weapon', court hears
item.description: Commercial property solicitor Vahideh Hojatoleslami, 28, allegedly struck Oluwakemi Tayo after he kicked her fiancé out of the VIP area of Loft Studio in Willesden, London.

item.title: Instagram influencer apologises for Durdle Door cliffs graffiti
item.description: Alexandra Milam, 24, travelled from London to the Jurassic Coast World Heritage site in Dorset, where she was snapped during a photo shoot in front of the 180-million-year-old rocks.

item.title: Four ways to change the shape of your nose without surgery
item.description: There are a number of other ways to change the shape of your nose other than going under the knife. Here experts share some of the most popular alternative methods with FEMAIL.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Over HALF young people are praying online
item.description: The poll showed that 'staggering' numbers of 18-24 year old's have been turning to god during the lockdown after places of worship were forced to close.

item.title: People share bizarre text messages from wrong numbers
item.description: People around the world have shared their most surprising text exchanges with strangers who had the wrong number. The amusing screenshots were compiled by BoredPanda.

item.title: Migrants crossing English Channel warn Britain they will attempt to DROWN if their boats are stopped
item.description: Families preparing to make the crossing to Britain from Calais claim the stretch of water will become 'a sea of bodies' if the British government intervenes and sends them back to France.

item.title: Psychologist says imposter's syndrome stops employees' success
item.description: Australian psychologist Sabina Read told recruitment company Seek many workers suffer from imposter syndrome, which is the inability to believe in your own success, abilities and self-worth.

item.title: Royal experts slam 'touchy-feely' Finding Freedom as the 'voice of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle'
item.description: Royal commentators have delivered their verdicts on Finding Freedom with expert Richard Kay commenting it 'invites the kind of intrusion the Duke and Duchess of Sussex are so quick to deplore'

item.title: McDonald's is bringing back six menu items TOMORROW including quarter pounder, and chicken legend
item.description: The fast food giant, which has 1,800 outlets in the UK, has announced the return of six popular items having previously opened with a limited menu following the easing of lockdown restrictions.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle secretly buy Santa Barbara home because 'it was not Harry's style'
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have been living in the home since early July, after staying in Tyler Perry's Beverly Hill's mansion for the last few months.

item.title: The devil is in the details! Hilarious snaps reveal disastrous consequences of ignoring common sense
item.description: For these designers a bad day at work has led to some long-lasting mistakes. Here are the worst examples of thoughtless design from around the world that are bound to make you cringe.
